description: PP3 files are helpful for photographers using RawTherapee who want a non-destructive editing workflow or need to apply the same settings to multiple images. RawTherapee users can also share the files with other users, allowing them to apply the same processing style to their photos.

When users edit a photo with RawTherapee, the software automatically creates a PP3 file to save their changes. This file is typically stored alongside the original image and uses the same filename but with the .pp3 extension applied. For example, a PP3 file for the example.CR3 image is named example.CR3.pp3 . Additionally, users can open the image in RawTherapee later, and the program will automatically load the settings from the PP3 file so they can continue editing or export the image with their previous adjustments.
NOTE: PP3 files are similar to .SIDECAR and .NKSC sidecar files used by Blackmagic and Nikon.
